block.p: Maria-Teresa Wilson, a daughter of Isis Rivero Hoffman of Key Biscayne, Fla., and Edward N. Wilson of Brooklyn, was married yesterday evening at her mother's summer home in Millbrook, N.Y., to Dr. Andrew Alan Samwick, a son of Marilyn and Gary Samwick of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla. The Rev. Dennis M. Corrado, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated, with Rabbi Devon Lerner taking part.

The couple work at Dartmouth College in Hanover, N.H. The bride designs and produces multimedia educational materials in the Interactive Media Laboratory of Dartmouth Medical School, and the bridegroom is an associate professor of economics.

Maria-Teresa Wilson, a daughter of Isis Rivero Hoffman of Key Biscayne, Fla., and Edward N. Wilson of Brooklyn, was married yesterday evening at her mother's summer home in Millbrook, N.Y., to Dr. Andrew Alan Samwick, a son of Marilyn and Gary Samwick of Palm Beach Gardens, Fla. The Rev. Dennis M. Corrado, a Roman Catholic priest, officiated, with Rabbi Devon Lerner taking part.

The couple work at Dartmouth College in Hanover, N.H. The bride designs and produces multimedia educational materials in the Interactive Media Laboratory of Dartmouth Medical School, and the bridegroom is an associate professor of economics.

Mrs. Samwick, 33, is known as Terry. She graduated from Kenyon College and received a master's degree in educational communication and technology from Columbia University Teachers College. The bride's father is a lawyer at the law office of Michael J. Simon in Manhattan. Her mother retired as the deputy vice president for operations of Columbia's health sciences division in Manhattan. The bride is a stepdaughter of Anne Wilson and of Dr. Brian F. Hoffman, who retired from Columbia's College of Physicians and Surgeons, where he was the chairman of the pharmacology department.

Dr. Samwick, 30, graduated summa cum laude from Harvard and received a doctorate in economics from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology. His mother is a real estate broker for Illustrated Properties in Palm Beach Gardens. His father is the president of the Industrial Marking Equipment Company, a printing machines manufacturer in Riviera Beach, Fla.
